entry.title: WIND ADVISORY TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT
entry.summary: December 26, 2023 3:50 a.m. A Wind Advisory remains in effect from 4:00 p.m. Tuesday through 7:00 pm. Wednesday for parts of southern Oregon. Forecasters at the National Weather Service said southeast winds of 25 to 35 miles per hour with gusts up to 50 miles per hour are expected. The Advisory area includes the...

entry.title: HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR COASTAL AREAS THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT
entry.summary: December 26, 2023 3:50 a.m. A High Surf Advisory remains in effect through 10:00 p.m. Thursday for the south- central Oregon coast and the Curry County coast. Forecasters at the National Weather Service said large breaking waves of 22 to 28 feet are expected. The Advisory area includes the beaches of Coos, Curry and Douglas...

entry.title: CITY OF ROSEBURG REMAINS CLOSED ON TUESDAY
entry.summary: December 26, 2023 3:40 a.m. City of Roseburg buildings remain closed Tuesday for the Christmas Holiday and will be closed again next Monday for the New Year’s holiday. A City release said that means that the Public Safety Center, Roseburg Public Library and other city buildings will not be open to the public. The library...

entry.title: MYRTLE CREEK ANNOUNCES PUBLIC MEETINGS
entry.summary: December 26, 2023 3:30 a.m. The City of Myrtle Creek has announced its schedule of public meetings for January. *The city council will meet January 2nd and January 23rd *The park commission will gather on January 9th *The planning commission will meet on January 23rd All meetings are held on Tuesdays beginning at 5:30 p.m....

entry.title: ORGANIZATIONS SEEK SUPREME COURT REVIEW OF O&C LANDS CASE
entry.summary: December 26, 2023 3:20 a.m. The American Forest Resources Council recently announced that 29 members of the U.S. Congress and six organizations have filed legal briefs in support of AFRC’s and the Association of O&C Counties join petition for a writ of certiorari with the U.S. Supreme Court. AFRC and AOCC are asking the Court...

entry.title: 2024 UMPQUA FISHERY ENHANCEMENT DERBY EVENTS LISTED
entry.summary: December 26, 2023 3:10 a.m. The 2024 annual Umpqua Fishery Enhancement Derby will include a series of events that benefit fish restoration, enhancement and education projects in the Umpqua Basin. It will take place January 31st through February 3rd. The Cow Creek Band of Umpqua Tribe of Indians is the Presenting Sponsor. Events include: *Wednesday,...

entry.title: WHALE WATCH WEEK BEGINS WEDNESDAY
entry.summary: December 26, 2023 2:50 a.m. Oregon State Parks will once again host Whale Watch Week from this Wednesday through Sunday. An Oregon Parks and Recreation Department release said every year thousands of gray whales migrate south through Oregon’s waters at the end of December and state parks invite visitors to the coast to see their...

entry.title: HOLIDAY CLOSURES FOR DECEMBER 25TH
entry.summary: December 25, 2023 6:30 a.m. This is Christmas and that means there are a number of closures. Federal, state, county and city officers are closed. Regular mail will not be delivered. Schools are not in session until after the new year. Professional offices are not open. Most retail stores are closed or are operating with...

entry.title: OSU Extension offers forestry program in Roseburg
entry.summary: ROSEBURG — Oregon State University Extension Office in Roseburg will offer a five-part series on small woodland management beginning on Jan. 24, 2024. The office is located at 1134 SE Douglas Ave. in Roseburg.

entry.title: Fish and Wildlife to host hunting class in Roseburg
entry.summary: ROSEBURG — Oregon Department of Fish and Wildlife will host a hunting education field day Jan. 20 at the Roseburg Rod and Gun Club, 875 Old Del Rio Road, Roseburg. The class will run 8 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. and…

entry.title: Everyone deserves a warm Christmas meal, woman hands out cookies and burritos
entry.summary: Dee Jay spent her weekend rolling bean, cheese and rice burritos, and baking sheets of sugar and oatmeal chocolate chip cookies for her holiday tradition: handing them out to the homeless community.

entry.title: Dealing with grief, gifted a holiday meal and toys
entry.summary: Anna Tavitas lost her spouse to a three-year battle with liver cancer just one month before Christmas.

entry.title: Lawmakers call for expanded funding for community health centers
entry.summary: Oregon U.S. Senators Ron Wyden and Jeff Merkley, along with Representatives Suzanne Bonamici and Andrea Salinas, joined bipartisan colleagues this week to urge the Health Resources and Services Administration to provide more access to federal resources for community healthcare centers.

entry.title: WINSTON MAN CITED FOLLOWING REPORTED RECKLESS DRIVING INCIDENT
entry.summary: December 23, 2023 8:00 a.m. A Winston man was cited following a traffic crash Thursday night. A Douglas County Sheriff’s Office report said at approximately 9:00 p.m. the 21-year old was allegedly seen racing his sports car and revving its engine in the 400 block of Dillard Gardens Road in the Dillard area. The man...

entry.title: DEPUTIES JAIL MAN FOR ALLEGED FIREARM VIOLATIONS
entry.summary: December 23, 2023 7:40 a.m. Deputies with the Douglas County Sheriff’s Office jailed a Roseburg man following alleged firearm violations, late Wednesday. A DCSO report said at about 11:40 p.m. a deputy stopped a sedan for traffic violations near the intersection of Southeast Elliot Avenue and Southeast Gross Street in the Canyonville area. The deputy...

entry.title: Library grateful for Douglas ESD partnership
entry.summary: One of the biggest wins in Roseburg Public Library’s first five years is our partnership with the Douglas Education Service District (ESD).

entry.title: Roseburg Elks Lodge hands out gratitude grants
entry.summary: The Roseburg Elks Lodge presented five $700 grants to local nonprofit organizations on Dec. 8. The money was given to the lodge from the Elks National Foundation’s Community Investment Program. The lodge received the money by reaching various benchmarks determined…

entry.title: Douglas Timber Operators award community members
entry.summary: Douglas Timber Operators awarded Pat Skrip, Paul Beck and Tim Freeman with the organization's Tough Tree Award, for going above and beyond for the forest industry, timber workers and natural resource dependent communities.
